Award.AwardTitle: Student Support for the 2018 ACM International Conference on Management of Data (SIGMOD-2018)

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Award.AbstractNarration:
This award provides support for about 16 students from U.S.-based institutions to attend the 2018 ACM SIGMOD International Conference on Management of Data, to be held in Houston, TX, USA (https://sigmod2018.org/) from June 10 to June 15, 2018. The provided support enables the students to attend the conference and discuss and disseminate their work. The conference also provides an opportunity for the students to interact with other students and senior researchers and form future national and international scientific collaborators. One of the SIGMOD goals it to broader participation of underrepresented students in database research and an effort will be made to have a diverse group of the supported students.

The SIGMOD conference, which was established in 1975, has a dynamic and comprehensive program for publication, education, and interaction, including research papers, tutorials, panels, industrial papers, technical demonstrations, and undergraduate research papers. The program includes publications relating to all aspects of data management defined broadly, and particularly encourages publications on topics of emerging interest in the research and development communities. The program also includes workshops on topics relevant to current data management research and development, industrial exhibits, and keynote talks by leaders in academia and industry. All these activities provide a unique opportunity for students to share their knowledge, experience, and research work with internationally recognized researchers from both academia and industry. In recent years, more than 600 researchers attended SIGMOD, and the same is expected this year. SIGMOD Proceedings will be accessible via the ACM Digital Library.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
ACM SIGMOD 2018 was held in Houston, Texas. The conference included a dynamic and comprehensive program, including research papers, tutorials, panels, industrial papers, technical demonstrations, undergraduate research papers. The program also included workshops that demand dedicated coverage due to their relevance to the current data management research and development, industrial exhibits, and keynote talks by leaders in academia and industry.

In addition to meeting industry (such as IBM, Microsoft, Oracle, SAP, NEC, HP, Google, Intel, Yahoo!) leaders during regular program sessions, this year students also actively participated in ?New Researcher? Symposium and the ACM Student Research Competition.

A PC reviewed  the initial abstract submissions and invite selected students to attend SIGMOD 2018 to present a poster. A panel of judges reviewed the posters and selected students to give a research talk on the next day where the final winners were determined. Three winners from each category were recognized in the conference and will receive prizes. Moreover, the grand winner from each category advanced to an ACM-wide competition.

 SIGMOD 2018 had 803 registrants, out of which 475 were from the US. In total, there were 41 countries represented at SIGMOD 2018: United States, Germany, China, Canada, Republic of Korea, United Kingdom, Singapore, Switzerland, France, Australia, Israel, Japan, Hong Kong, Greece, Belgium, Qatar, Italy, Denmark, Netherlands, Chile, Russian Federation, India, Austria, Spain, Brazil, Czech Republic, Colombia, The Democratic Republic of Congo, Sri Lanka, Guinea, Saudi Arabia, New Zealand, Hungary, Poland, Sweden, Finland, Estonia, United Arab Emirates, Luxembourg, Macao, Mexico.

The search committee included 3 members (Senjuti Basu Roy from New Jersey Institute of Technology, Ahmed Abukmail from University of Houston-Clear Lake, and Parth Nagarkar from New Mexico State University) to review application materials (that included student research summary and rationale explaining the expected benefits for the applicants).

The NSF grant was used to provide varying degrees of support, where the maximum awarded amount was $1000, to 20 students matriculated in US institutions and who have actively participated in the conference through presentations, technical demonstrations, and other direct contributions to the SIGMOD program.

 The broad impacts included training and development of the future generation of leaders and workforce in the increasingly critical field of data management. Awardees were given priority access to on-site and off-line educational and mentorship events.

Here are a few comments from students who have received NSF support for attending the conference:

* "The travel award allowed me to stay for the whole week of SIGMOD. I was able to attend many relevant sessions to my research and make invaluable connections with researchers in my field, in addition to presenting my tutorial."

* "The travel award helped me in covering travel and hotel costs to attend SIGMOD 2018. Attending conferences is essential for my PhD studies. Without the travel grant, I may have not been able to attend the conference."

* "It let me present at the SIGMOD poster session and experience my first academic conference."

* "The travel award helped me to cover part of the costs associated with traveling to the SIGMOD conference in Houston, TX to present my paper. The award also have waived the conference registration fees. The fact that I have received the award helped my advisor to financially support me and his other students. Participation in SIGMOD conference allowed me to share the details of my research with broad set of database community members, build professional network and learn about state of the art topics in database research."

* "It supports me to attend the conference, where I got connected with many top researchers in Database field. It's a great experience. Thanks!"

* "This award allowed me to present my workshop paper and learn about state-of-the-art database research by attending talks and socializing with area experts."
